Package edu.ncsu.csc216.pack_scheduler.directory

Class FacultyDirectory

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.ncsu.csc216.pack_scheduler.directory.FacultyDirectory
  • public class FacultyDirectory
extends java.lang.Object
    Maintains a directory of all faculties enrolled at NC State. All faculties have a unique id. This directory is comprised of a sortedList. The faculty records are sorted by lastName, firstName, and ID.
    Author:
    Will Goodwin, Matt Church, John Firlet

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      FacultyDirectory()
      Creates an empty faculty directory object

    • Constructor Detail

      • FacultyDirectory

        public FacultyDirectory()
        Creates an empty faculty directory object

    • Method Detail

      • newFacultyDirectory

        public void newFacultyDirectory()
        Creates an empty faculty directory. All faculties in the previous list are list unless saved by the user.

      • loadFacultyFromFile

        public void loadFacultyFromFile​(java.lang.String fileName)
        Constructs the faculty directory by reading in faculty information from the given file. Throws an IllegalArgumentException if the file cannot be found.
        Parameters:
        fileName - file containing list of faculties
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the file passed in from FacultyRecordIO can not be found or read

      • addFaculty

        public boolean addFaculty​(java.lang.String firstName,
                          java.lang.String lastName,
                          java.lang.String id,
                          java.lang.String email,
                          java.lang.String password,
                          java.lang.String repeatPassword,
                          int maxCourses)
        Adds a Faculty to the directory. Returns true if the faculty is added and false if the Faculty is unable to be added because their id matches another Faculties id. This method also hashes the Faculties password for internal storage.
        Parameters:
        firstName - Faculties first name
        lastName - Faculties last name
        id - Faculties id
        email - Faculties email
        password - Faculties password
        repeatPassword - Faculties repeated password
        maxCourses - Faculties max credits.
        Returns:
        true if added
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the parameterized password is invalid, the hash algorithm is invalid, or the repeat password does not match the original password

      • removeFaculty

        public boolean removeFaculty​(java.lang.String facultyId)
        Removes the Faculty with the given ID from the list of Faculties. Returns true if the Faculty is removed and false if the Faculty is not in the list.
        Parameters:
        facultyId - the Faculty id
        Returns:
        true if the Faculty is successfully removed from the directory

      • getFacultyDirectory

        public java.lang.String[][] getFacultyDirectory()
        Returns all Faculty in the directory with a column for first name, last name, and id.
        Returns:
        two-dimensional String array containing Faculty first name, last name, and id.

      • saveFacultyDirectory

        public void saveFacultyDirectory​(java.lang.String fileName)
        Saves all Faculty in the directory to a file.
        Parameters:
        fileName - name of file to save Faculty to
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if unable to write the FacultyDirectory to the file passed in from FacultyRecordIO

      • getFacultyById

        public Faculty getFacultyById​(java.lang.String id)
        Returns the Faculty by the ID that is passed to the method
        Parameters:
        id - ID of the Faculty to return
        Returns:
        faculty returns the Faculty of the given ID
